title: ‘Let’s revive Europe!’ European leaders call for ‘FEDERAL UNION’ to save crumbling EU
text:
‘Let’s revive Europe!’ European leaders call for ‘FEDERAL UNION’ to save crumbling EU ‘Let’s revive Europe!’ European leaders call for ‘FEDERAL UNION’ to save crumbling EU FOUR European leaders have called for a European “Federal Union” to strengthen the relationship between states as Brussels approaches its first "divorce settlement" on its 60th anniversary. PUBLISHED: 23:52, Sun, Feb 26, 2017 | UPDATED: 01:13, Mon, Feb 27, 2017 GETTY Representatives from Merkel's Germany and France, Luxembourg and Italy published a letter rallying a 
Representatives from lower parliament chambers in France, Italy, Germany and Luxembourg wrote a letter in La Stampa, an Italian newspaper, rallying member states to not be “paralysed by fear” of Brexit , or “concerns related to upcoming elections in other countries”. Related articles Brexit: Free movement for new EU migrants ‘could END by March’ 
Claude Bartolone of the French National Assembly, Laura Boldrini of the Italian Chamber of Deputies, Norbert Lammert of the German Bundestag, and Mars Di Bartolomeo of the Luxembourg Chamber of Deputies published the letter in the run-up to the meeting of parliamentary leaders in Rome on March 17. 
The leaders will gather to mark the 60th anniversary of the Treaty of Rome, which founded the European Economic Community, before the Union formed. Why these nations could leave the Eurozone Fri, February 24, 2017 Heavily indebted Greece has no acute shortage of money, but will need money again from the ongoing aid programme this summer. But Athens is not the only shaky candidate of the Eurozone. These are the other countries causing worries Play slideshow 1 of 7 
During the anniversary meeting, the leaders hope to “return the vision and spirit” the EU’s founding fathers created the alliance with, which has since helped member states develop in terms of “health and fundamental rights”. 
Their joint letter read: “Now is the moment to move towards closer political integration – the Federal Union of States with broad powers. 
“We know that the prospect stirs up strong resistance, but the inaction of some cannot be the analysis of all. 
“Those who believe in European ideals, should be able to give them a new life instead of helplessly observing its slow sunset.” 
According to their warnings, the European integration project is currently “more at risk” than ever before because of “populist, nationalist and even xenophobic movements”. GETTY EU leaders at the Summit in Malta 
Last week, Conservative MEP Ashley Fox slapped down EU’s chief Brexit negotiator, Guy Verhofstadt, who outlined plans for the European Commission to become a “genuine government”. 
In a comment piece for the BrexitCentral website, Mr Fox said: “People are questioning what the EU does and whether it should be doing it at all. 
“Mr Verhofstadt’s vision for the future of the EU is flawed and not representative of the citizens of Europe.” Related articles
